All women who have a landed title may now serve as an Advisor on the ruler's council.\n

All women who have a landed title, as well as those who are of the liege's dynasty (including all close relatives and the liege's spouse) may lead armies and hold the office of [Root.Holder.GetMarshalName] so long as they also have either the §YMartial Lady§!, §YLady of Horse and Bow§!, or §YShield Maiden§! trait.\n

You can choose to dispute any single-county Exclave that borders you. Beware that choosing to wage a conquest not backed by a Claim carries a penalty. You will take an opinion hit from all your neighbors and their vassals if they border your realm.
Recent Succession

The recent succession may cause some political turmoil within your realm. Your council will be §YDiscontent§!, and your vassals are more likely to make demands and form §YClaimant§! factions against you.\nIf you are a King or Emperor, becoming coronated (through the decision) and gaining the §YCrowned§! trait will help ease the tensions.
Matrilineal marriages will be §Gallowed§!.\n
Matrilineal marriages will be §Rdisallowed§!.\n

Reforming the $RELIGION$ faith will turn it into an organized religion with a religious head. Unless you control all of the Holy Sites, doing so requires §Y$AUTHORITY_REQ$§! Moral Authority and control of §Y$HOLY_SITES_REQ$§! $RELIGION$ holy sites. It will cost you §R$PIETY_COST$§! [Player.Religion.GetPietyName]. Rulers of a Reformed Pagan religion can use the Holy War Casus Belli, get access to most succession laws, no longer suffer Prestige loss while at peace, and will have less trouble with independent-minded vassals. However, they also lose the ability to raid, county conquest and subjugation Casus Bellis, defensive supply limit penalty for religious enemies in their territory, and vassals will get upset if you have their levies raised for too long for no good reason.
